title.narrative: Support for the participation of WCSOs in media debates with policy-makers and religious leaders: Niger

description.narrative: 2 debates were organized in a local TV, in French and in Zarma. The topics of these debates focused on “Women’s rights in the security context” and “the economic and social rights of women in conflict zones”. Policymakers were represented in these debates, such as the senior executives of public institutions, including the Commissioners at the NCHR, and the Director of the Promotion of Female Leadership in the Ministry of Women's Empowerment and Child Protection.

In Niger, opened dialogues in media was initiated with policy-makers and WCSOs on the representation of women in politics, and the human women’s right in the hostile context in Niger. Senior executive officers of public administration took part to theses dialogues, which had been organized with some constraints. These debates, carefully prepared by the trained WR-CSOs got some results at least: opening these dialogues to a wider audience, because the main audio-visual media selected for these debates were those with the largest audience in the country.

The objective pursued through these debates was to amplify the voices of women in the media on concerns that affect them on the one hand; and initiate a public debate between CSOs and policy makers and opinion leaders on women's rights issues.
